thread.title: Jamie Carragher joins sports stars watching David Haye vs Tony Bellew grudge match
thread.title_full: Jamie Carragher joins sports stars watching David Haye vs Tony Bellew grudge match

author: Jim Daly
title: Jamie Carragher joins sports stars watching David Haye vs Tony Bellew grudge match
text:
Sport Jamie Carragher joins sports stars watching David Haye vs Tony Bellew grudge match Watford striker Troy Deeney was also there for the much anticipated bout as was star jockey AP McCoy Share Jamie Carragher, Frank Bruno and Chris Eubank Jr get ready to watch Haye vs Bellew (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool legend Jamie Carragher swapped the football pitch for the boxing ring as he was in attendance to see the David Haye vs Tony Bellew clash . 
The Sky Sports pundit made his way down from Anfield to the O2 Arena in London having been a pundit for Liverpool's 3-1 win over Arsenal. 
He was joined for the heavyweight grudge match by star jockey AP McCoy. 
Watford striker Troy Deeney was also there for the much anticipated bout. JP McManus, AP McCoy and Jamie Carragher (Photo: Getty) Frank Bruno and James DeGale (Photo: REUTERS) Chris Eubank Jr looks on from ringside (Photo: Getty) 
Some famous faces from the world of boxing were also in attendance with Chris Eubank Jnr and Frank Bruno turning up. Chris Eubank Jr looks on from ringside (Photo: Getty) Troy Deeney of Watford (Photo: BPI) Britain's heavyweight boxer Anthony Joshua sits in the audience (Photo: AFP) Anthony Joshua with Dereck Chisora (Photo: REUTERS) Anthony Joshua with Carl Froch (Photo: REUTERS) 
The build-up to the fight has seen a lot of attention. 
The Hayemaker tipped the scales at 225.0 lbs, gaining almost a stone advantage over the Bomber, who weighed 213.3 lbs. 
And Haye claims he is in tremendous shape and that he is an athlete, while his rival is not and that will be the difference in the ring. 
"I put on some good healthy, usable muscle," Haye told Sky Sports News HQ. "He's just eaten some pies. 
"I've watched my food. My diet is tighter now than when I was as a cruiserweight. I feel better than ever, you'll see a destructive performance. (Photo: PA)
